definition: covered all over with cuts and bruises/beaten black and blue/be a mass of bruises
everywhere/all over/classifier for actions: one time
variant of 遍[bian4]
body/form/style/system/substance/to experience/aspect (linguistics)
scales (of fish)
to injure/injury/wound

sentences.english: They Covered Their Bodies With Bruises And Wounds, And Denied Them Food And Shelter.
sentences.chinese: 他们都被弄得遍体鳞伤，也得不到食物和住处。

sentences.english: The hull was pocked with dents.
But after were beatenblack and blue, thats when we know were just thegrass.
sentences.chinese: 可是最后遍体鳞伤，我才知道我们原来都只是草。

sentences.english: Other gamblers beat him black and blue since he lost but couldn't pay.
sentences.chinese: 他赌输了，又付不出钱，其它赌徒把他揍得遍体鳞伤。

sentences.english: Why to don't want the whole body covered with wounds that ego move.
sentences.chinese: 为什么非要把自己动的遍体鳞伤。

sentences.english: Self-deception is likely to get the better of you this week.
sentences.chinese: 自欺欺人只会弄得自己遍体鳞伤。

sentences.english: The man threatened to beat the boy black and blue for stealing.
sentences.chinese: 那人威吓要把偷东西得孩子打得遍体鳞伤。

sentences.english: Do not play too true acting, otherwise it will bear the scars.
sentences.chinese: 演戏别演太真，不然会遍体鳞伤。

sentences.english: His body was bruised, his hands were bleeding, and his rags were all besmirched with mud .
sentences.chinese: 他已遍体鳞伤，手上在流血，一身破衣服沾满了污泥。

sentences.english: It was my bloody thorn cusp , black and blue.
sentences.chinese: 它的尖角刺得我鲜血淋漓，遍体鳞伤。

definition: bruised/riddled with scars
cuts and bruises like fish scales/terribly cut up
lit. head broken and blood flowing/fig. badly bruised
to be drenched with blood/dripping blood
a bloody nose and a swollen face/badly battered
see 百孔千瘡|百孔千疮[bai3 kong3 qian1 chuang1]
lit. cuts and bruises all over (idiom); fig. totally refuted
flesh lacerated from corporal punishment (idiom)
battered and exhausted/stuck in a dilemma
dying/at one's last gasp
spirit weary, strength exhausted (idiom); spent/drained/washed out
spirit weary, strength exhausted (idiom); spent/drained/washed out
to be badly mangled or mutilated (idiom)
a black eye (idiom); serious injury to the face/fig. a setback/a defeat
to hover between life and death (idiom)/to suffer terribly/within an inch of one's life
body weary, strength exhausted (idiom); extremely tired/spent
